definitions.definition: To bring to, or direct toward, a common center; to unite more closely; to gather into one body, mass, or force.
definitions.example: to concentrate rays of light into a focus

definitions.definition: To increase the strength and diminish the bulk of, as of a liquid or an ore; to intensify, by getting rid of useless material; to condense.
To approach or meet in a common center; to consolidate.
definitions.example: Population tends to concentrate in cities.

definitions.definition: To focus one's thought or attention (on).
Not dilute; having a high concentration.
definitions.example: We made a drink from concentrated orange juice.

definitions.definition: Intense; directed towards a specific location.
definitions.example: The concentrated fire from the enemy destroyed our fortifications.
